Package me.chloe.raiderlib.drive

Class SwerveModule

java.lang.Object
me.chloe.raiderlib.drive.SwerveModule
public class SwerveModule extends Object
SwerveModule class used to construct each individual module in a more simple matter.

  • Method Details

    • setDriveMotor

      public void setDriveMotor(double dutyCycle)
      Set the speed of the drive motor in percent duty cycle
      Parameters:
      dutyCycle - a number between -1.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is not moving, as percent duty cycle

    • setDriveMotorVelocity

      public void setDriveMotorVelocity(double velocity)

    • setRotationMotor

      public void setRotationMotor(double dutyCycle)
      Set the speed of the rotation motor in percent duty cycle
      Parameters:
      dutyCycle - a number between -1.0 and 1.0, where 0.0 is not moving, as percent duty cycle

    • setRotationMotorPosition

      public void setRotationMotorPosition(double encoderPosition)

    • setDriveMotorMode

      public void setDriveMotorMode(com.ctre.phoenix.motorcontrol.NeutralMode neutral)
      Sets drive motor to brake or coast
      Parameters:
      neutral - whether to brake or coast

    • getDriveDistance

      public double getDriveDistance()
      Returns:
      the distance the drive wheel has traveled (in meters)

    • getDriveVelocity

      public double getDriveVelocity()
      Returns the speed of the drive wheel in Meters per second
      Returns:
      speed of the drive wheel

    • getDriveInput

      public double getDriveInput()
      Returns the speed of the drive wheel in Percent
      Returns:
      input of the drive wheel

    • resetDriveMotorEncoder

      public void resetDriveMotorEncoder()
      A method to set the position of the drive encoder to zero, essentially resetting it.

    • zeroAbsPositionSensor

      public void zeroAbsPositionSensor()
      The CANCoder has a mechanical zero point, this is hard to move, so this method is used to change the offset of the CANCoder so we dictate the zero position as the current position of the module.

    • getAbsPosInDeg

      public double getAbsPosInDeg()
      The CANCoder reads the absolute rotational position of the module. This method returns that positon in degrees. note: NOT Inverted module safe (use getPosInRad())
      Returns:
      the position of the module in degrees, should limit from -180 to 180

    • setDriveMotorPIDF

      public void setDriveMotorPIDF(double P, double I, double D, double F)
      sets the drive motor's PIDF for the PIDF controller on the TalonFX
      Parameters:
      P - value of the P constant
      I - value of the I constant
      D - value of the D constant
      F - value of the F constant

    • setRotationMotorPIDF

      public void setRotationMotorPIDF(double P, double I, double D, double F)
      sets the rotation motor's PIDF for the PIDF controller on the TalonFX
      Parameters:
      P - value of the P constant
      I - value of the I constant
      D - value of the D constant
      F - value of the F constant

    • getCurRot2d

      public edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d getCurRot2d()
      Returns the current angle of the swerve module, as read by the absolute rotational sensor, as a Rotation2d object. This is measured from the front of the robot, where counter-clockwise is positive.
      Returns:
      A Rotation2d object, current position of the module

    • getPosInRad

      public double getPosInRad()
      This method gets the current position in radians and normally the zero is at the front of the robot.
      Returns:
      the position of the module in radians, should limit from -PI to PI

    • getModuleState

      public edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState getModuleState()
      Returns the current state of the swerve module as a SwerveModuleState. The speed of the module should be in m/s and the rotational position is in the form of a Rotation2d object.
      Returns:
      a SwerveModuleState

    • getModulePosition

      public edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModulePosition getModulePosition()
      Returns the current position of the swerve module as a SwerveModulePosition. The position of the module should be in meters and the rotational position is in the form of a Rotation2d object.
      Returns:
      a SwerveModulePosition

    • resetRotationSensorPosition

      public void resetRotationSensorPosition()

    • getRelEncCount

      public double getRelEncCount()
      This is a method meant for testing by getting the count from the rotational encoder which is internal to the TalonFX. This encoder is relative, and does not easily translate to a specific rotational position of the swerve module.
      Returns:
      the encoder count(no units, naturally just the count)

    • setModuleState

      public void setModuleState(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState targetState)
      The method to set the module to a position and speed. This method does the opitimization internally. The speed should be from -1.0 to 1.0 if isVeloMode is false, and should be between -MAX_VELOCITY and MAX_VELOCITY if isVeloMode is true.
      Parameters:
      targetState - SwerveModuleState

    • setModuleStateDutyCycle

      public void setModuleStateDutyCycle(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState targetState)

    • stopAll

      public void stopAll()
      This method is used to stop the module completely. The drive motor is switched to percent voltage and and output of 0.0 percent volts. The rotation motor's PIDController is set to DutyCyclevoltage control mode, and output of 0.0% output.

    • optimize

      public static edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState optimize(edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.SwerveModuleState desiredState, edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d currentAngle)
      Minimize the change in heading the desired swerve module state would require by potentially reversing the direction the wheel spins. If this is used with the PIDController class's continuous input functionality, the furthest a wheel will ever rotate is 90 degrees.
      Parameters:
      desiredState - The desired state.
      currentAngle - The current module angle.
      Returns:
      Optimized swerve module state.
